== Usage ==
== Usage ==
â
The service allows users to [[upload]] files of up to 200 [[Megabyte|MB]] each for free and 10 [[Gigabyte|GB]] for paid subscribers. Paid Subscribers have a 20,000 file limit. The user is then supplied with a unique [[URL]], which locates the file and enables anyone who knows it to [[download]] the file. Uploaded files will be stored as long as the user logs-in into his/her account at least once every 60 days or at least one of the files is downloaded every 30 days.<ref name="mediafire_faq_storage_time">[http://support.mediafire.com/index.php?_m=knowledgebase&_a=viewarticle&kbarticleid=2&nav=0 Mediafire FAQ: How long will my uploaded files be stored?]</ref> Furthermore, images can be uploaded and displayed in galleries.
+
The service allows users to [[upload]] files of up to 200 [[Megabyte|MB]] each for free and 10 [[Gigabyte|GB]] for paid subscribers. Paid Subscribers have a 20,000 file limit{{fact}}. The user is then supplied with a unique [[URL]], which locates the file and enables anyone who knows it to [[download]] the file. Uploaded files will be stored as long as the user logs-in into his/her account at least once every 60 days or at least one of the files is downloaded every 30 days.<ref name="mediafire_faq_storage_time">[http://support.mediafire.com/index.php?_m=knowledgebase&_a=viewarticle&kbarticleid=2&nav=0 Mediafire FAQ: How long will my uploaded files be stored?]</ref> Furthermore, images can be uploaded and displayed in galleries.
== Features ==
== Features ==
